document.docAuthor: Ríos-Málaver, Juan Sebastián Dueñas Cáceres ı Cristóbal & Grossi, Paschoal Coelho
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic contribution on the Andean species of Aegognathus (Coleoptera: Lucanidae) with two new species from Colombia and Peru

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic contribution on the Andean species of Aegognathus (Coleoptera: Lucanidae) with two new species from Colombia and Peru

mods:name.mods:namePart: Ríos-Málaver, Juan Sebastián Dueñas Cáceres ı Cristóbal

subSubSection.paragraph: Colour : as males but always presenting darker tones along the whole body. Head : Shape smaller than malesı subquadrateı narrower than the pronotum; strongly punctate; mandibles subequalı presenting a variable transverse tooth. Pronotum : Surface strongly and uniformly punctateı angles more distinctı anterior ones usually acuteı posterior ones somewhat rounded; anterior margins reaching the posterior region of head. Elytra : surface strongly punctateı punctures contiguousı coarse with yellowish erect setaeı becoming denser posteriorly. Legs : General aspect strongerı less slenderı with a variable number of external teeth on protibiae. Venter : Punctures more distinctı and almost uniformly distributed along entire ventral surface; discrimen generally more distinct than in males. Genitalia : Gonostyli symmetricı slightly prolonged laterally with somewhat truncate posterior margin presenting some scattered setae. Accessory glandı broadı almost as large as the gonocoxites together. Bursa copulatrix slightly wider at baseı getting narrower distallyı sometimes uniformly broadı cylindrical. Spermatheca narrowı C-shaped with sclerotised dilated apex. Spermathecal gland absent. Supra anal projection subtrianguları with acuminate to rounded apex.

Remarks. The genus currently includes 10 species described for Colombiaı Ecuadorı Peru and Brazilı the Peruvian and Ecuadorian species being better known or more frequently collected. The first described species
A. waterhousei
was registered for Chanchamayo in Peruı subsequentlyı other species were described for Colombia ( Van De Poll 1886 )ı Brazil ( Luederwaldt 1935 )ı Ecuador ( Bartolozzi et al. 1991 ) and other regions of Peru (
Arnaud and Bomans 2004
ı 2006aı 2006bı 2007).
